segment_text: “Holmes,” said I as I stood one morning in our bow-window looking down the street, “here is a madman coming along. It seems rather sad that his relatives should allow him to come out alone.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: My friend rose lazily from his armchair and stood with his hands in the pockets of his dressing-gown, looking over my shoulder.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: It was a bright, crisp February morning, and the snow of the day before still lay deep upon the ground, shimmering brightly in the wintry sun.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Down the centre of Baker Street it had been ploughed into a brown crumbly band by the traffic, but at either side and on the heaped-up edges of the footpaths it still lay as white as when it fell.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: The grey pavement had been cleaned and scraped, but was still dangerously slippery, so that there were fewer passengers than usual.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Indeed, from the direction of the Metropolitan Station no one was coming save the single gentleman whose eccentric conduct had drawn my attention.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He was a man of about fifty, tall, portly, and imposing, with a massive, strongly marked face and a commanding figure.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He was dressed in a sombre yet rich style, in black frock-coat, shining hat, neat brown gaiters, and well-cut pearl-grey trousers.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Yet his actions were in absurd contrast to the dignity of his dress and features, for he was running hard, with occasional little springs, such as a weary man gives who is little accustomed to set any tax upon his legs.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: As he ran he jerked his hands up and down, waggled his head, and writhed his face into the most extraordinary contortions.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “What on earth can be the matter with him?” I asked. “He is looking up at the numbers of the houses.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I believe that he is coming here,” said Holmes, rubbing his hands.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Here?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Yes; I rather think he is coming to consult me professionally. I think that I recognise the symptoms.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Ha! did I not tell you?” As he spoke, the man, puffing and blowing, rushed at our door and pulled at our bell until the whole house resounded with the clanging.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: A few moments later he was in our room, still puffing, still gesticulating, but with so fixed a look of grief and despair in his eyes that our smiles were turned in an instant to horror and pity.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: For a while he could not get his words out, but swayed his body and plucked at his hair like one who has been driven to the extreme limits of his reason.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Then, suddenly springing to his feet, he beat his head against the wall with such force that we both rushed upon him and tore him away to the centre of the room.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes pushed him down into the easy-chair and, sitting beside him, patted his hand and chatted with him in the easy, soothing tones which he knew so well how to employ.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “You have come to me to tell your story, have you not?” said he. “You are fatigued with your haste.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Pray wait until you have recovered yourself, and then I shall be most happy to look into any little problem which you may submit to me.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: The man sat for a minute or more with a heaving chest, fighting against his emotion. Then he passed his handkerchief over his brow, set his lips tight, and turned his face towards us.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “No doubt you think me mad?” said he.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I see that you have had some great trouble,” responded Holmes.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “God knows I have!—a trouble which is enough to unseat my reason, so sudden and so terrible is it.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Public disgrace I might have faced, although I am a man whose character has never yet borne a stain.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Private affliction also is the lot of every man; but the two coming together, and in so frightful a form, have been enough to shake my very soul.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Besides, it is not I alone. The very noblest in the land may suffer unless some way be found out of this horrible affair.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Pray compose yourself, sir,” said Holmes, “and let me have a clear account of who you are and what it is that has befallen you.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “My name,” answered our visitor, “is probably familiar to your ears. I am Alexander Holder, of the banking firm of Holder & Stevenson, of Threadneedle Street.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: The name was indeed well known to us as belonging to the senior partner in the second largest private banking concern in the City of London.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: What could have happened, then, to bring one of the foremost citizens of London to this most pitiable pass? We waited, all curiosity, until with another effort he braced himself to tell his story.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I feel that time is of value,” said he; “that is why I hastened here when the police inspector suggested that I should secure your co-operation.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I came to Baker Street by the Underground and hurried from there on foot, for the cabs go slowly through this snow.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: That is why I was so out of breath, for I am a man who takes very little exercise. I feel better now, and I will put the facts before you as shortly and yet as clearly as I can.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “It is, of course, well known to you that in a successful banking business as much depends upon our being able to find remunerative investments for our funds as upon our increasing our connection and the number of our depositors.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: One of our most lucrative means of laying out money is in the shape of loans, where the security is unimpeachable.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: We have done a good deal in this direction during the last few years, and there are many noble families to whom we have advanced large sums upon the security of their pictures, libraries, or plate.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Yesterday morning I was seated in my office at the bank when a card was brought in to me by one of the clerks.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: I started when I saw the name, for it was that of none other than—well, perhaps even to you I had better say no more than that it was a name which is a household word all over the earth—one of the highest, noblest, most exalted names in England.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: I was overwhelmed by the honour and attempted, when he entered, to say so, but he plunged at once into business with the air of a man who wishes to hurry quickly through a disagreeable task.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘Mr. Holder,’ said he, ‘I have been informed that you are in the habit of advancing money.’
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘The firm does so when the security is good.’ I answered.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘It is absolutely essential to me,’ said he, ‘that I should have £ 50,000 at once.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: I could, of course, borrow so trifling a sum ten times over from my friends, but I much prefer to make it a matter of business and to carry out that business myself.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: In my position you can readily understand that it is unwise to place one’s self under obligations.’
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘For how long, may I ask, do you want this sum?’ I asked.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘Next Monday I have a large sum due to me, and I shall then most certainly repay what you advance, with whatever interest you think it right to charge.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: But it is very essential to me that the money should be paid at once.’
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘I should be happy to advance it without further parley from my own private purse,’ said I, ‘were it not that the strain would be rather more than it could bear.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: If, on the other hand, I am to do it in the name of the firm, then in justice to my partner I must insist that, even in your case, every businesslike precaution should be taken.’
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘I should much prefer to have it so,’ said he, raising up a square, black morocco case which he had laid beside his chair. ‘You have doubtless heard of the Beryl Coronet?’
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘One of the most precious public possessions of the empire,’ said I.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘Precisely.’ He opened the case, and there, imbedded in soft, flesh-coloured velvet, lay the magnificent piece of jewellery which he had named.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: ‘There are thirty-nine enormous beryls,’ said he, ‘and the price of the gold chasing is incalculable.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: The lowest estimate would put the worth of the coronet at double the sum which I have asked. I am prepared to leave it with you as my security.’
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “I took the precious case into my hands and looked in some perplexity from it to my illustrious client.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘You doubt its value?’ he asked.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘Not at all. I only doubt—’
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘The propriety of my leaving it. You may set your mind at rest about that.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: I should not dream of doing so were it not absolutely certain that I should be able in four days to reclaim it. It is a pure matter of form.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: Is the security sufficient?’
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘Ample.’
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “‘You understand, Mr. Holder, that I am giving you a strong proof of the confidence which I have in you, founded upon all that I have heard of you.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: I rely upon you not only to be discreet and to refrain from all gossip upon the matter but, above all, to preserve this coronet with every possible precaution because I need not say that a great public scandal would be caused if any harm were to befall it.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: Any injury to it would be almost as serious as its complete loss, for there are no beryls in the world to match these, and it would be impossible to replace them.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: I leave it with you, however, with every confidence, and I shall call for it in person on Monday morning.’
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “Seeing that my client was anxious to leave, I said no more but, calling for my cashier, I ordered him to pay over fifty £ 1000 notes.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: When I was alone once more, however, with the precious case lying upon the table in front of me, I could not but think with some misgivings of the immense responsibility which it entailed upon me.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: There could be no doubt that, as it was a national possession, a horrible scandal would ensue if any misfortune should occur to it. I already regretted having ever consented to take charge of it.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: However, it was too late to alter the matter now, so I locked it up in my private safe and turned once more to my work.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: “When evening came I felt that it would be an imprudence to leave so precious a thing in the office behind me.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: Bankers’ safes had been forced before now, and why should not mine be? If so, how terrible would be the position in which I should find myself!
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: I determined, therefore, that for the next few days I would always carry the case backward and forward with me, so that it might never be really out of my reach.
scene_description: indoors, bank office, mahogany desk, leather chair, official documents.

segment_text: With this intention, I called a cab and drove out to my house at Streatham, carrying the jewel with me.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I did not breathe freely until I had taken it upstairs and locked it in the bureau of my dressing-room.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “And now a word as to my household, Mr. Holmes, for I wish you to thoroughly understand the situation.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: My groom and my page sleep out of the house, and may be set aside altogether.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I have three maid-servants who have been with me a number of years and whose absolute reliability is quite above suspicion.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: Another, Lucy Parr, the second waiting-maid, has only been in my service a few months. She came with an excellent character, however, and has always given me satisfaction.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: She is a very pretty girl and has attracted admirers who have occasionally hung about the place. That is the only drawback which we have found to her, but we believe her to be a thoroughly good girl in every way.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “So much for the servants. My family itself is so small that it will not take me long to describe it.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I am a widower and have an only son, Arthur. He has been a disappointment to me, Mr. Holmes—a grievous disappointment.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I have no doubt that I am myself to blame. People tell me that I have spoiled him. Very likely I have.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: When my dear wife died I felt that he was all I had to love. I could not bear to see the smile fade even for a moment from his face.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I have never denied him a wish. Perhaps it would have been better for both of us had I been sterner, but I meant it for the best.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “It was naturally my intention that he should succeed me in my business, but he was not of a business turn.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: He was wild, wayward, and, to speak the truth, I could not trust him in the handling of large sums of money.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: When he was young he became a member of an aristocratic club, and there, having charming manners, he was soon the intimate of a number of men with long purses and expensive habits.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: He learned to play heavily at cards and to squander money on the turf, until he had again and again to come to me and implore me to give him an advance upon his allowance, that he might settle his debts of honour.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: He tried more than once to break away from the dangerous company which he was keeping, but each time the influence of his friend, Sir George Burnwell, was enough to draw him back again.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “And, indeed, I could not wonder that such a man as Sir George Burnwell should gain an influence over him, for he has frequently brought him to my house, and I have found myself that I could hardly resist the fascination of his manner.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: He is older than Arthur, a man of the world to his finger-tips, one who had been everywhere, seen everything, a brilliant talker, and a man of great personal beauty.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: Yet when I think of him in cold blood, far away from the glamour of his presence, I am convinced from his cynical speech and the look which I have caught in his eyes that he is one who should be deeply distrusted.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: So I think, and so, too, thinks my little Mary, who has a woman’s quick insight into character.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “And now there is only she to be described. She is my niece; but when my brother died five years ago and left her alone in the world I adopted her, and have looked upon her ever since as my daughter.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: She is a sunbeam in my house—sweet, loving, beautiful, a wonderful manager and housekeeper, yet as tender and quiet and gentle as a woman could be.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: She is my right hand. I do not know what I could do without her.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: In only one matter has she ever gone against my wishes. Twice my boy has asked her to marry him, for he loves her devotedly, but each time she has refused him.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I think that if anyone could have drawn him into the right path it would have been she, and that his marriage might have changed his whole life; but now, alas! it is too late—forever too late!
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “Now, Mr. Holmes, you know the people who live under my roof, and I shall continue with my miserable story.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “When we were taking coffee in the drawing-room that night after dinner, I told Arthur and Mary my experience, and of the precious treasure which we had under our roof, suppressing only the name of my client.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: Lucy Parr, who had brought in the coffee, had, I am sure, left the room; but I cannot swear that the door was closed.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: Mary and Arthur were much interested and wished to see the famous coronet, but I thought it better not to disturb it.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Where have you put it?’ asked Arthur.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘In my own bureau.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Well, I hope to goodness the house won’t be burgled during the night.’ said he.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘It is locked up,’ I answered.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Oh, any old key will fit that bureau. When I was a youngster I have opened it myself with the key of the box-room cupboard.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “He often had a wild way of talking, so that I thought little of what he said. He followed me to my room, however, that night with a very grave face.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Look here, dad,’ said he with his eyes cast down, ‘can you let me have £ 200?’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘No, I cannot!’ I answered sharply. ‘I have been far too generous with you in money matters.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘You have been very kind,’ said he, ‘but I must have this money, or else I can never show my face inside the club again.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘And a very good thing, too!’ I cried.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Yes, but you would not have me leave it a dishonoured man,’ said he. ‘I could not bear the disgrace.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I must raise the money in some way, and if you will not let me have it, then I must try other means.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “I was very angry, for this was the third demand during the month. ‘You shall not have a farthing from me,’ I cried, on which he bowed and left the room without another word.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “When he was gone I unlocked my bureau, made sure that my treasure was safe, and locked it again.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: Then I started to go round the house to see that all was secure—a duty which I usually leave to Mary but which I thought it well to perform myself that night.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: As I came down the stairs I saw Mary herself at the side window of the hall, which she closed and fastened as I approached.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Tell me, dad,’ said she, looking, I thought, a little disturbed, ‘did you give Lucy, the maid, leave to go out to-night?’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Certainly not.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘She came in just now by the back door. I have no doubt that she has only been to the side gate to see someone, but I think that it is hardly safe and should be stopped.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘You must speak to her in the morning, or I will if you prefer it. Are you sure that everything is fastened?’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Quite sure, dad.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Then, good-night.’ I kissed her and went up to my bedroom again, where I was soon asleep.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “I am endeavouring to tell you everything, Mr. Holmes, which may have any bearing upon the case, but I beg that you will question me upon any point which I do not make clear.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “On the contrary, your statement is singularly lucid.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I come to a part of my story now in which I should wish to be particularly so. I am not a very heavy sleeper, and the anxiety in my mind tended, no doubt, to make me even less so than usual.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: About two in the morning, then, I was awakened by some sound in the house. It had ceased ere I was wide awake, but it had left an impression behind it as though a window had gently closed somewhere.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I lay listening with all my ears. Suddenly, to my horror, there was a distinct sound of footsteps moving softly in the next room.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I slipped out of bed, all palpitating with fear, and peeped round the corner of my dressing-room door.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Arthur!’ I screamed, ‘you villain! you thief! How dare you touch that coronet?’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “The gas was half up, as I had left it, and my unhappy boy, dressed only in his shirt and trousers, was standing beside the light, holding the coronet in his hands.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: He appeared to be wrenching at it, or bending it with all his strength. At my cry he dropped it from his grasp and turned as pale as death.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I snatched it up and examined it. One of the gold corners, with three of the beryls in it, was missing.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘You blackguard!’ I shouted, beside myself with rage. ‘You have destroyed it! You have dishonoured me forever! Where are the jewels which you have stolen?’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Stolen!’ he cried.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Yes, thief!’ I roared, shaking him by the shoulder.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘There are none missing. There cannot be any missing,’ said he.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘There are three missing. And you know where they are. Must I call you a liar as well as a thief?
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: Did I not see you trying to tear off another piece?’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘You have called me names enough,’ said he, ‘I will not stand it any longer. I shall not say another word about this business, since you have chosen to insult me.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I will leave your house in the morning and make my own way in the world.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘You shall leave it in the hands of the police!’ I cried half-mad with grief and rage. ‘I shall have this matter probed to the bottom.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘You shall learn nothing from me,’ said he with a passion such as I should not have thought was in his nature. ‘If you choose to call the police, let the police find what they can.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “By this time the whole house was astir, for I had raised my voice in my anger.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: Mary was the first to rush into my room, and, at the sight of the coronet and of Arthur’s face, she read the whole story and, with a scream, fell down senseless on the ground.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I sent the housemaid for the police and put the investigation into their hands at once.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: When the inspector and a constable entered the house, Arthur, who had stood sullenly with his arms folded, asked me whether it was my intention to charge him with theft.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I answered that it had ceased to be a private matter, but had become a public one, since the ruined coronet was national property. I was determined that the law should have its way in everything.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘At least,’ said he, ‘you will not have me arrested at once. It would be to your advantage as well as mine if I might leave the house for five minutes.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘That you may get away, or perhaps that you may conceal what you have stolen,’ said I.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: And then, realising the dreadful position in which I was placed, I implored him to remember that not only my honour but that of one who was far greater than I was at stake; and that he threatened to raise a scandal which would convulse the nation.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: He might avert it all if he would but tell me what he had done with the three missing stones.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘You may as well face the matter,’ said I; ‘you have been caught in the act, and no confession could make your guilt more heinous.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: If you but make such reparation as is in your power, by telling us where the beryls are, all shall be forgiven and forgotten.’
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: “‘Keep your forgiveness for those who ask for it,’ he answered, turning away from me with a sneer.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I saw that he was too hardened for any words of mine to influence him. There was but one way for it.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: I called in the inspector and gave him into custody. A search was made at once not only of his person but of his room and of every portion of the house where he could possibly have concealed the gems; but no trace of them could be found, nor would the wretched boy open his mouth for all our persuasions and our threats.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian residence, nighttime, gas-lit hallway, wooden bureau.

segment_text: This morning he was removed to a cell, and I, after going through all the police formalities, have hurried round to you to implore you to use your skill in unravelling the matter.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: The police have openly confessed that they can at present make nothing of it. You may go to any expense which you think necessary.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I have already offered a reward of £ 1000. My God, what shall I do!
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I have lost my honour, my gems, and my son in one night. Oh, what shall I do!”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He put a hand on either side of his head and rocked himself to and fro, droning to himself like a child whose grief has got beyond words.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes sat silent for some few minutes, with his brows knitted and his eyes fixed upon the fire.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Do you receive much company?” he asked.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “None save my partner with his family and an occasional friend of Arthur’s. Sir George Burnwell has been several times lately.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: No one else, I think.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Do you go out much in society?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Arthur does. Mary and I stay at home. We neither of us care for it.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “That is unusual in a young girl.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “She is of a quiet nature. Besides, she is not so very young. She is four-and-twenty.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “This matter, from what you say, seems to have been a shock to her also.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Terrible! She is even more affected than I.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “You have neither of you any doubt as to your son’s guilt?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “How can we have when I saw him with my own eyes with the coronet in his hands.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I hardly consider that a conclusive proof. Was the remainder of the coronet at all injured?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Yes, it was twisted.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Do you not think, then, that he might have been trying to straighten it?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “God bless you! You are doing what you can for him and for me. But it is too heavy a task.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: What was he doing there at all? If his purpose were innocent, why did he not say so?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Precisely. And if it were guilty, why did he not invent a lie? His silence appears to me to cut both ways.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: There are several singular points about the case. What did the police think of the noise which awoke you from your sleep?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “They considered that it might be caused by Arthur’s closing his bedroom door.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “A likely story! As if a man bent on felony would slam his door so as to wake a household. What did they say, then, of the disappearance of these gems?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “They are still sounding the planking and probing the furniture in the hope of finding them.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Have they thought of looking outside the house?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Yes, they have shown extraordinary energy. The whole garden has already been minutely examined.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Now, my dear sir,” said Holmes, “is it not obvious to you now that this matter really strikes very much deeper than either you or the police were at first inclined to think?
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: It appeared to you to be a simple case; to me it seems exceedingly complex. Consider what is involved by your theory.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: You suppose that your son came down from his bed, went, at great risk, to your dressing-room, opened your bureau, took out your coronet, broke off by main force a small portion of it, went off to some other place, concealed three gems out of the thirty-nine, with such skill that nobody can find them, and then returned with the other thirty-six into the room in which he exposed himself to the greatest danger of being discovered.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I ask you now, is such a theory tenable?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “But what other is there?” cried the banker with a gesture of despair. “If his motives were innocent, why does he not explain them?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “It is our task to find that out,” replied Holmes; “so now, if you
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: please, Mr. Holder, we will set off for Streatham together, and devote an hour to glancing a little more closely into details.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: My friend insisted upon my accompanying them in their expedition, which I was eager enough to do, for my curiosity and sympathy were deeply stirred by the story to which we had listened.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I confess that the guilt of the banker’s son appeared to me to be as obvious as it did to his unhappy father, but still I had such faith in Holmes’ judgment that I felt that there must be some grounds for hope as long as he was dissatisfied with the accepted explanation.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He hardly spoke a word the whole way out to the southern suburb, but sat with his chin upon his breast and his hat drawn over his eyes, sunk in the deepest thought.
scene_description: railway carriage, snow-covered path, suburban houses

segment_text: Our client appeared to have taken fresh heart at the little glimpse of hope which had been presented to him, and he even broke into a desultory chat with me over his business affairs.
scene_description: railway carriage, snow-covered path, suburban houses

segment_text: A short railway journey and a shorter walk brought us to Fairbank, the modest residence of the great financier.
scene_description: railway carriage, snow-covered path, suburban houses

segment_text: Fairbank was a good-sized square house of white stone, standing back a little from the road.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: A double carriage-sweep, with a snow-clad lawn, stretched down in front to two large iron gates which closed the entrance.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: On the right side was a small wooden thicket, which led into a narrow path between two neat hedges stretching from the road to the kitchen door, and forming the tradesmen’s entrance.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: On the left ran a lane which led to the stables, and was not itself within the grounds at all, being a public, though little used, thoroughfare.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: Holmes left us standing at the door and walked slowly all round the house, across the front, down the tradesmen’s path, and so round by the garden behind into the stable lane.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: So long was he that Mr. Holder and I went into the dining-room and waited by the fire until he should return.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: We were sitting there in silence when the door opened and a young lady came in.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: She was rather above the middle height, slim, with dark hair and eyes, which seemed the darker against the absolute pallor of her skin.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: I do not think that I have ever seen such deadly paleness in a woman’s face.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: Her lips, too, were bloodless, but her eyes were flushed with crying.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: As she swept silently into the room she impressed me with a greater sense of grief than the banker had done in the morning, and it was the more striking in her as she was evidently a woman of strong character, with immense capacity for self-restraint.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: Disregarding my presence, she went straight to her uncle and passed her hand over his head with a sweet womanly caress.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “You have given orders that Arthur should be liberated, have you not, dad?” she asked.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “No, no, my girl, the matter must be probed to the bottom.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “But I am so sure that he is innocent. You know what woman’s instincts are.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: I know that he has done no harm and that you will be sorry for having acted so harshly.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Why is he silent, then, if he is innocent?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Who knows? Perhaps because he was so angry that you should suspect him.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “How could I help suspecting him, when I actually saw him with the coronet in his hand?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Oh, but he had only picked it up to look at it. Oh, do, do take my word for it that he is innocent.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: Let the matter drop and say no more. It is so dreadful to think of our dear Arthur in prison!”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “I shall never let it drop until the gems are found—never, Mary! Your affection for Arthur blinds you as to the awful consequences to me.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: Far from hushing the thing up, I have brought a gentleman down from London to inquire more deeply into it.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “This gentleman?” she asked, facing round to me.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “No, his friend. He wished us to leave him alone.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: He is round in the stable lane now.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “The stable lane?” She raised her dark eyebrows.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “What can he hope to find there? Ah! this, I suppose, is he.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: I trust, sir, that you will succeed in proving, what I feel sure is the truth, that my cousin Arthur is innocent of this crime.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “I fully share your opinion, and I trust, with you, that we may prove it,” returned Holmes, going back to the mat to knock the snow from his shoes.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “I believe I have the honour of addressing Miss Mary Holder. Might I ask you a question or two?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Pray do, sir, if it may help to clear this horrible affair up.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “You heard nothing yourself last night?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Nothing, until my uncle here began to speak loudly. I heard that, and I came down.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “You shut up the windows and doors the night before. Did you fasten all the windows?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Yes.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Were they all fastened this morning?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Yes.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “You have a maid who has a sweetheart? I think that you remarked to your uncle last night that she had been out to see him?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Yes, and she was the girl who waited in the drawing-room, and who may have heard uncle’s remarks about the coronet.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “I see. You infer that she may have gone out to tell her sweetheart, and that the two may have planned the robbery.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “But what is the good of all these vague theories,” cried the banker impatiently, “when I have told you that I saw Arthur with the coronet in his hands?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Wait a little, Mr. Holder. We must come back to that.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: About this girl, Miss Holder. You saw her return by the kitchen door, I presume?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Yes; when I went to see if the door was fastened for the night I met her slipping in. I saw the man, too, in the gloom.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Do you know him?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Oh, yes! he is the greengrocer who brings our vegetables round. His name is Francis Prosper.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “He stood,” said Holmes, “to the left of the door—that is to say, farther up the path than is necessary to reach the door?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “Yes, he did.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “And he is a man with a wooden leg?”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: Something like fear sprang up in the young lady’s expressive black eyes. “Why, you are like a magician,” said she.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “How do you know that?” She smiled, but there was no answering smile in Holmes’ thin, eager face.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: “I should be very glad now to go upstairs,” said he. “I shall probably wish to go over the outside of the house again.
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: Perhaps I had better take a look at the lower windows before I go up.”
scene_description: indoors, dining room, fireplace, victorian furniture

segment_text: He walked swiftly round from one to the other, pausing only at the large one which looked from the hall onto the stable lane.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: This he opened and made a very careful examination of the sill with his powerful magnifying lens.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: “Now we shall go upstairs,” said he at last.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: The banker’s dressing-room was a plainly furnished little chamber, with a grey carpet, a large bureau, and a long mirror.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: Holmes went to the bureau first and looked hard at the lock.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “Which key was used to open it?” he asked.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “That which my son himself indicated—that of the cupboard of the lumber-room.”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “Have you it here?”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “That is it on the dressing-table.”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes took it up and opened the bureau.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “It is a noiseless lock,” said he. “It is no wonder that it did not wake you.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: This case, I presume, contains the coronet. We must have a look at it.”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: He opened the case, and taking out the diadem he laid it upon the table.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: It was a magnificent specimen of the jeweller’s art, and the thirty-six stones were the finest that I have ever seen.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: At one side of the coronet was a cracked edge, where a corner holding three gems had been torn away.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “Now, Mr. Holder,” said Holmes, “here is the corner which corresponds to that which has been so unfortunately lost. Might I beg that you will break it off.”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: The banker recoiled in horror. “I should not dream of trying,” said he.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “Then I will.” Holmes suddenly bent his strength upon it, but without result.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “I feel it give a little,” said he; “but, though I am exceptionally strong in the fingers, it would take me all my time to break it.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: An ordinary man could not do it. Now, what do you think would happen if I did break it, Mr. Holder?
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: There would be a noise like a pistol shot. Do you tell me that all this happened within a few yards of your bed and that you heard nothing of it?”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “I do not know what to think. It is all dark to me.”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “But perhaps it may grow lighter as we go. What do you think, Miss Holder?”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “I confess that I still share my uncle’s perplexity.”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “Your son had no shoes or slippers on when you saw him?”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “He had nothing on save only his trousers and shirt.”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: “Thank you. We have certainly been favoured with extraordinary luck during this inquiry, and it will be entirely our own fault if we do not succeed in clearing the matter up.
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: With your permission, Mr. Holder, I shall now continue my investigations outside.”
scene_description: indoors, plainly furnished chamber, grey carpet, large bureau, long mirror

segment_text: He went alone, at his own request, for he explained that any unnecessary footmarks might make his task more difficult.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: For an hour or more he was at work, returning at last with his feet heavy with snow and his features as inscrutable as ever.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: “I think that I have seen now all that there is to see, Mr. Holder,” said he; “I can serve you best by returning to my rooms.”
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: “But the gems, Mr. Holmes. Where are they?”
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: “I cannot tell.”
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: The banker wrung his hands. “I shall never see them again!” he cried.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: “And my son? You give me hopes?”
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: “My opinion is in no way altered.”
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: “Then, for God’s sake, what was this dark business which was acted in my house last night?”
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: “If you can call upon me at my Baker Street rooms to-morrow morning between nine and ten I shall be happy to do what I can to make it clearer.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: I understand that you give me _carte blanche_ to act for you, provided only that I get back the gems, and that you place no limit on the sum I may draw.”
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: “I would give my fortune to have them back.”
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: “Very good. I shall look into the matter between this and then.
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: Good-bye; it is just possible that I may have to come over here again before evening.”
scene_description: outdoors, white stone house, snow-clad lawn, iron gates

segment_text: It was obvious to me that my companion’s mind was now made up about the case, although what his conclusions were was more than I could even dimly imagine.
scene_description: railway carriage, snow-covered path, suburban houses

segment_text: Several times during our homeward journey I endeavoured to sound him upon the point, but he always glided away to some other topic, until at last I gave it over in despair.
scene_description: railway carriage, snow-covered path, suburban houses

segment_text: It was not yet three when we found ourselves in our rooms once more.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He hurried to his chamber and was down again in a few minutes dressed as a common loafer.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: With his collar turned up, his shiny, seedy coat, his red cravat, and his worn boots, he was a perfect sample of the class.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I think that this should do,” said he, glancing into the glass above the fireplace.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I only wish that you could come with me, Watson, but I fear that it won’t do. I may be on the trail in this matter, or I may be following a will-o’-the-wisp, but I shall soon know which it is.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I hope that I may be back in a few hours.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He cut a slice of beef from the joint upon the sideboard, sandwiched it between two rounds of bread, and thrusting this rude meal into his pocket he started off upon his expedition.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I had just finished my tea when he returned, evidently in excellent spirits, swinging an old elastic-sided boot in his hand.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He chucked it down into a corner and helped himself to a cup of tea.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I only looked in as I passed,” said he. “I am going right on.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Where to?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Oh, to the other side of the West End. It may be some time before I get back.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Don’t wait up for me in case I should be late.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “How are you getting on?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Oh, so so. Nothing to complain of.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I have been out to Streatham since I saw you last, but I did not call at the house.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: It is a very sweet little problem, and I would not have missed it for a good deal.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: However, I must not sit gossiping here, but must get these disreputable clothes off and return to my highly respectable self.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I could see by his manner that he had stronger reasons for satisfaction than his words alone would imply.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: His eyes twinkled, and there was even a touch of colour upon his sallow cheeks.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He hastened upstairs, and a few minutes later I heard the slam of the hall door, which told me that he was off once more upon his congenial hunt.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I waited until midnight, but there was no sign of his return, so I retired to my room.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: It was no uncommon thing for him to be away for days and nights on end when he was hot upon a scent, so that his lateness caused me no surprise.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I do not know at what hour he came in, but when I came down to breakfast in the morning there he was with a cup of coffee in one hand and the paper in the other, as fresh and trim as possible.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “You will excuse my beginning without you, Watson,” said he, “but you remember that our client has rather an early appointment this morning.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Why, it is after nine now,” I answered. “I should not be surprised if that were he.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I thought I heard a ring.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: It was, indeed, our friend the financier.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I was shocked by the change which had come over him, for his face which was naturally of a broad and massive mould, was now pinched and fallen in, while his hair seemed to me at least a shade whiter.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He entered with a weariness and lethargy which was even more painful than his violence of the morning before, and he dropped heavily into the armchair which I pushed forward for him.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I do not know what I have done to be so severely tried,” said he.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Only two days ago I was a happy and prosperous man, without a care in the world. Now I am left to a lonely and dishonoured age.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: One sorrow comes close upon the heels of another. My niece, Mary, has deserted me.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Deserted you?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Yes. Her bed this morning had not been slept in, her room was empty, and a note for me lay upon the hall table.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I had said to her last night, in sorrow and not in anger, that if she had married my boy all might have been well with him.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Perhaps it was thoughtless of me to say so. It is to that remark that she refers in this note:
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “‘MY DEAREST UNCLE,—I feel that I have brought trouble upon you, and that if I had acted differently this terrible misfortune might never have occurred.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I cannot, with this thought in my mind, ever again be happy under your roof, and I feel that I must leave you forever.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Do not worry about my future, for that is provided for; and, above all, do not search for me, for it will be fruitless labour and an ill-service to me.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: In life or in death, I am ever your loving, “‘MARY.’
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “What could she mean by that note, Mr. Holmes? Do you think it points to suicide?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “No, no, nothing of the kind. It is perhaps the best possible solution.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I trust, Mr. Holder, that you are nearing the end of your troubles.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Ha! You say so! You have heard something, Mr. Holmes; you have learned something!
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Where are the gems?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “You would not think £ 1000 apiece an excessive sum for them?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I would pay ten.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “That would be unnecessary. Three thousand will cover the matter.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: And there is a little reward, I fancy. Have you your cheque-book?
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Here is a pen. Better make it out for £ 4000.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: With a dazed face the banker made out the required check.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Holmes walked over to his desk, took out a little triangular piece of gold with three gems in it, and threw it down upon the table.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: With a shriek of joy our client clutched it up.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “You have it!” he gasped. “I am saved! I am saved!”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: The reaction of joy was as passionate as his grief had been, and he hugged his recovered gems to his bosom.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “There is one other thing you owe, Mr. Holder,” said Sherlock Holmes rather sternly.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Owe!” He caught up a pen. “Name the sum, and I will pay it.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “No, the debt is not to me. You owe a very humble apology to that noble lad, your son, who has carried himself in this matter as I should be proud to see my own son do, should I ever chance to have one.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Then it was not Arthur who took them?”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I told you yesterday, and I repeat to-day, that it was not.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “You are sure of it! Then let us hurry to him at once to let him know that the truth is known.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “He knows it already. When I had cleared it all up I had an interview with him, and finding that he would not tell me the story, I told it to him, on which he had to confess that I was right and to add the very few details which were not yet quite clear to me.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Your news of this morning, however, may open his lips.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “For Heaven’s sake, tell me, then, what is this extraordinary mystery!”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I will do so, and I will show you the steps by which I reached it.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: And let me say to you, first, that which it is hardest for me to say and for you to hear: there has been an understanding between Sir George Burnwell and your niece Mary. They have now fled together.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “My Mary? Impossible!”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “It is unfortunately more than possible; it is certain. Neither you nor your son knew the true character of this man when you admitted him into your family circle.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He is one of the most dangerous men in England—a ruined gambler, an absolutely desperate villain, a man without heart or conscience.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Your niece knew nothing of such men. When he breathed his vows to her, as he had done to a hundred before her, she flattered herself that she alone had touched his heart.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: The devil knows best what he said, but at least she became his tool and was in the habit of seeing him nearly every evening.”
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I cannot, and I will not, believe it!” cried the banker with an ashen face.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “I will tell you, then, what occurred in your house last night. Your niece, when you had, as she thought, gone to your room, slipped down and talked to her lover through the window which leads into the stable lane.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: His footmarks had pressed right through the snow, so long had he stood there. She told him of the coronet.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: His wicked lust for gold kindled at the news, and he bent her to his will.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: I have no doubt that she loved you, but there are women in whom the love of a lover extinguishes all other loves, and I think that she must have been one.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: She had hardly listened to his instructions when she saw you coming downstairs, on which she closed the window rapidly and told you about one of the servants’ escapade with her wooden-legged lover, which was all perfectly true.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: “Your boy, Arthur, went to bed after his interview with you but he slept badly on account of his uneasiness about his club debts.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: In the middle of the night he heard a soft tread pass his door, so he rose and, looking out, was surprised to see his cousin walking very stealthily along the passage until she disappeared into your dressing-room.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Petrified with astonishment, the lad slipped on some clothes and waited there in the dark to see what would come of this strange affair.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: Presently she emerged from the room again, and in the light of the passage-lamp your son saw that she carried the precious coronet in her hands.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: She passed down the stairs, and he, thrilling with horror, ran along and slipped behind the curtain near your door, whence he could see what passed in the hall beneath.
scene_description: bow-window, snow-covered street, Victorian room, fireplace.

segment_text: He saw her stealthily open the window, hand out the coronet to someone in the gloom, and then closing it once more hurry back to her room, passing quite close to where he stood hid behind the curtain.
